verbs.description: deallocate (third-person singular simple present deallocates, present participle deallocating, simple past and past participle deallocated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove from the set of resources put aside for (allocated to) a particular user or purpose.
examples: Empty out your locker; it will be deallocated at the end of the day.

entries.meaning: (transitive, computing) To return previously allocated memory.
examples: Computer programs should deallocate memory they no longer need, releasing it back to the system.
